subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Truth About Recycling Rates
description: Learn The Truth About Recycling Rates in one minute.

hook.text: Only 9% of all plastic ever produced has been recycled. Most ended up in landfills or nature.

buildup.text: Recycling rates vary wildly by material. Aluminum is recycled 75% of the time. Plastic barely at all.

discovery.text: Many items thrown in recycling bins are too contaminated or mixed to actually be recycled.

twist.text: The recycling symbol on packaging doesn't mean it will be recycled â€” just that it's technically possible.

climax.text: Without better sorting technology and markets for recycled material, most recycling is wishful thinking.

punchline.text: That recycling bin is more hopeful than honest.

quiz.question: What percentage of all plastic ever produced has been recycled?
